content.question: The function <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="g of x equals, the fraction with numerator 7 x minus 26, and denominator x minus 5, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>7</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>26</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. The function <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="h of x equals, the fraction with numerator 3 x plus 14, and denominator 2 x plus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>14</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. If <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is a function that satisfies <math alttext="g of x is less than or equal to f of x, which is less than or equal to h of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="0 less than x, less than 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, what is <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 2, of, f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The limit cannot be determined from the information given.

topic.text: 1.8: Determining Limits Using the Squeeze Theorem

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Confirm whether hypotheses or conditions of a selected definition, theorem, or test have been satisfied.
